definitions: reptile with a bony shell enclosing its body for protection
graphical cursor or drawing tool in computer programming languages
examples: The sea turtle swam gracefully through the coral reef
A giant turtle basked on the sunny riverbank
Children learned programming by moving the turtle across the screen
The turtle graphics library makes it easy to draw shapes

definitions: small wild dove with soft purring call and gentle nature
examples: The turtledove cooed softly from the oak tree branch
European turtledoves migrate to Africa for the winter months

definitions: long pointed tooth projecting from the mouth of certain animals
examples: The elephant's ivory tusks were impressively long and curved
Walrus tusks help them haul themselves onto ice floes

definitions: elephant or other animal possessing prominent tusks especially an adult male
examples: The old tusker led the elephant herd to water
Hunters once prized tuskers for their valuable ivory

definitions: rough physical struggle or scuffle between people
vigorous dispute or conflict over an issue or position
examples: The boys had a brief tussle over the basketball
Security guards broke up the tussle outside the stadium
The board had a tussle over the budget allocation
Their legal tussle lasted for several years

definitions: dense clump or tuft of grass or similar vegetation
examples: She carefully stepped between the tussocks in the marshy field
Tussocks of ornamental grass decorated the garden landscape

definitions: protection and instruction provided by a guardian or teacher over time
examples: She studied piano under the tutelage of a master musician
The young prince grew wise under his mentor's careful tutelage

definitions: person who gives individual or small group instruction
university teacher responsible for the teaching and supervision of assigned students
examples: She hired a math tutor to help with calculus
The tutor met with students twice weekly for extra help
His college tutor advised him on course selection
The tutor supervised her doctoral dissertation research

definitions: teaching session for individual or small group instruction
written or video guide providing step-by-step instruction on a topic
examples: Students attended a tutorial on essay writing techniques
The weekly tutorial helped clarify difficult concepts
She followed an online tutorial to learn photo editing
The software includes a comprehensive tutorial for beginners

definitions: short projecting skirt worn by ballet dancers made of layered tulle
examples: The ballerina's pink tutu sparkled under the stage lights
She practiced pirouettes in her new classical tutu

definitions: informal term for tuxedo formal evening suit for men
examples: He rented a tux for his senior prom night
The groom looked sharp in his black tux

definitions: man's formal evening suit with satin lapels typically worn with bow tie
examples: He wore a classic black tuxedo to the gala
The tuxedo rental shop offered various styles and sizes

definitions: sharp vibrating sound like that of a plucked string
distinctive nasal quality in speech characteristic of certain regional accents
examples: The guitar string broke with a loud twang
The twang of the bow echoed through the archery range
Her Texas twang was immediately recognizable
He spoke with a distinctive country twang

definitions: fine adjustment or modification to improve something
examples: The design needs just a few tweaks before production
A small tweak to the recipe made it perfect

definitions: rough woolen fabric with mixed flecked colors originally made in Scotland
examples: His tweed jacket was perfect for the autumn weather
Harris tweed remains popular for traditional country clothing

definitions: chirping sound made by small birds
short message posted on the social media platform Twitter
examples: The morning air filled with the tweets of sparrows
A robin's cheerful tweet announced the dawn
Her tweet about the event went viral overnight
The celebrity's controversial tweet sparked heated debate

definitions: loudspeaker designed to reproduce high-frequency sounds
person who posts messages on the social media platform Twitter
examples: The tweeter in the speaker system handles the treble frequencies
He replaced the damaged tweeter in his car stereo
She's a prolific tweeter with thousands of followers
Political tweeters often shape public discourse online

definitions: number twelve in a sequence or position in order
examples: December is the twelfth month of the year
She finished twelfth in the marathon race

definitions: cardinal number between eleven and thirteen equal to dozen
examples: There are twelve months in a calendar year
The clock struck twelve at midnight

definitions: number twenty in a sequence or position in order
examples: The twentieth century brought unprecedented technological change
She celebrated her twentieth birthday with family

definitions: cardinal number equal to two times ten
examples: The meeting lasted twenty minutes longer than expected
She saved twenty dollars from her allowance

definitions: slender woody shoot growing from branch or stem of tree
examples: Birds gathered twigs to build their nest
The dry twig snapped under his foot

definitions: soft glowing light from sky when sun is below horizon
period of decline following peak of success or glory
examples: They walked home in the peaceful twilight
Twilight painted the sky in shades of purple and orange
He spent his twilight years writing his memoirs
The empire entered its twilight after centuries of dominance

definitions: one of two offspring born at same birth
one of two identical or similar things forming a pair
examples: The twins looked so alike nobody could tell them apart
She has a twin brother who lives in Seattle
The twin towers dominated the city skyline
They bought twin beds for the guest room

definitions: strong thread or string made of twisted strands
examples: She tied the package with sturdy kitchen twine
The gardener used twine to support the tomato plants

definitions: light that shines with rapid intermittent gleams
sparkle or gleam especially in someone's eyes showing amusement
examples: Stars twinkle in the clear night sky
Christmas lights created a magical twinkle
There was a mischievous twinkle in her eye
His eyes held a twinkle of amusement

definitions: action of turning or rotating something
unexpected development or change in situation or story
thing with spiral shape or form from being twisted
examples: Give the lid a firm twist to open
A twist of her wrist unlocked the door
The movie's plot twist surprised everyone
The story took an unexpected twist
She added a lemon twist to the cocktail
The road had many dangerous twists and turns

definitions: violent rotating column of air extending from thunderstorm to ground
complex or difficult situation that causes confusion
examples: The twister destroyed several homes in its path
Storm chasers tracked the twister across Oklahoma
The legal case became a real twister of conflicting testimonies
That math problem is a real brain twister

definitions: continuous action of turning or rotating in different directions
quality of having curves or turns in shape or path
examples: The twisting of the rope made it stronger
Constant twisting weakened the metal wire
The twisting mountain road challenged even experienced drivers
The river's twisting path carved through the valley

definitions: sudden brief jerking movement
involuntary contraction of muscle or group of muscles
examples: She noticed a nervous twitch in his eye
The cat's tail gave an annoyed twitch
The muscle twitch in his leg kept him awake
Stress can cause facial twitches

definitions: repeated involuntary jerking movements of muscles or body parts
examples: The twitching in her eyelid lasted several days
His nervous twitching became more pronounced under stress

definitions: series of light tremulous sounds made by birds
state of nervous excitement or agitated chatter
examples: The morning twitter of birds filled the garden
A cheerful twitter came from the sparrows
The classroom was all a-twitter about the surprise test
Her nervous twitter of conversation filled the silence

definitions: cardinal number between one and three
examples: She has two children attending the same school
The recipe calls for two cups of flour

definitions: wealthy and powerful person in business or industry
examples: The oil tycoon donated millions to charity
Media tycoons control much of the news industry

definitions: action of fastening or binding with string or rope
process of connecting or linking things together
examples: Tying shoelaces is one of the first skills children learn
The tying of the knot requires careful attention
The tying of economic policies to social outcomes is complex
Tying the two systems together took months of work

definitions: category of things having common characteristics
printed or written characters and their style or design
examples: What type of music do you prefer
This type of behavior is unacceptable
The book was printed in large type
She changed the type to a more readable font

definitions: particular design of printed letters and characters in consistent style
examples: The designer chose an elegant typeface for the wedding invitations
Times New Roman is a widely used typeface

definitions: typed or printed version of written work before final publication
examples: The author submitted the typescript to her editor
Several corrections were made to the original typescript

definitions: person who arranges type for printing
machine that sets type for printing automatically
examples: The typesetter carefully arranged each letter for the press
Skilled typesetters were essential to newspaper production
The automatic typesetter revolutionized the printing industry
Modern typesetters use computer-controlled systems

definitions: mechanical or electric machine with keys for producing printed characters
examples: She typed her novel on an old manual typewriter
The clicking of typewriter keys filled the newsroom

definitions: infectious bacterial disease causing fever and red spots spread through contaminated water
examples: Typhoid outbreaks were common before modern sanitation
The typhoid vaccine is recommended for travelers to certain regions

definitions: violent tropical cyclone occurring in the western Pacific or Indian oceans
examples: The typhoon brought devastating winds to the coastal region
Ships altered course to avoid the approaching typhoon

definitions: action or skill of writing with typewriter or computer keyboard
examples: Her typing speed exceeded ninety words per minute
Typing classes were standard in business schools

definitions: person who types especially as professional occupation
examples: The typist transcribed the doctor's notes accurately
Skilled typists were in high demand before computers

definitions: typographical error or mistake in typed or printed text
examples: The document contained several embarrassing typos
She quickly corrected the typo before sending the email

definitions: person who designs and arranges type and printed matter professionally
examples: The typographer created a unique font for the brand
Skilled typographers balance aesthetics with readability

definitions: art and technique of arranging type to make written language readable and appealing
examples: Good typography enhances the reading experience significantly
She studied typography at the design school

definitions: systematic classification or study of types sharing common characteristics
examples: The researcher developed a typology of leadership styles
Linguistic typology compares structures across different languages

definitions: cruel and oppressive government or rule exercised with absolute power
examples: The people rose up against the tyranny of the dictator
They fought to end the tyranny that had lasted decades

definitions: cruel and oppressive ruler who exercises power without legal restraint
examples: The tyrant ruled with an iron fist for twenty years
History remembers him as a brutal tyrant
